intro: Gymnandra longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered gymnandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. Gymnandra longiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
